comment: I learned things by doing things wrong. She would teach one thing, and then I guess forget what's in her own powerpoints and count it off. For some reason, she didn't like giving the right answer in feedback; she just said it was wrong.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This class should be combined with cultural comp. She cancelled class 5 times and it was a one time a week class. It was a laidback class till November when she realized how much we had missed. Very sweet person but very unorganized class. There's a group project so choose wisely. Easy grade if you stay on top of the work and CHECK DUE DATES

Was very laid back but to the point where she was not prepared or teaching much. She cancelled class half the semester but still gave you busy work to do at home. Easy work to do but did not learn anything the entire semester.
She is very good at keeping everyone involved.  She hardly lectures, but does a lot of activities.  She doesn't give busy work.  Take her if you can!!

She is a pretty average teacher. You have to apply yourself to pass, but it is not a difficult class.  I would not mind taking her again. She does take role everyday, and you will sometimes need to use your book... especially because she expects you to read to discuss things in class.
Wonderful and sweet professor! She is very positive and wants all of her students to succeed.
Super nice and understanding.  Easy to talk to and willing to work with you. Great professor.
She cares about her students. Wants everyone to succeed and learn at the same time.

Prof Kennett is an AWESOME instructor with years of experience. Yes at the beginning we used 2 texts and eventually stuck to one. Read the required chapters and review the ppt before class. Questions are from readings. If you attend class (as it is mandatory) Prof Kennett will remember you by name, whether you sit in the front, back, or middle.

This is by far my worst class at KSU. I hate going to the class because all she does is read from the power points verbatim. Tests consist of multiple chapters from two different books with no study guide or any kind of review. She doesn't respond to emails and only talks to her favorites on the front row. Will not budge on attendance at all.
